captions.text:
God must have been
a fuckin' genius.

They say the hair
is everything, you know.

Have you ever buried your nose
in a mountain of curls...

and iust wanted
to go to sleep forever ?

and when they touched,
yours were like...

after you iust crossed
the desert.

nipples staring
right out at ya...

l don't care if
they're Greek columns...

there's only two syllables
in this whole wide world worth hearing:

Are you listening to me, son ?
l'm givin' you pearls here.

l guess you
really like women.

This is iust the start
of your education, son.

title: Scent of a Woman (2/8) Movie CLIP - Frank's Pearls of Wisdom (1992) HD

comments.author: Michael Westmoreland

comments.text:
This might be my favourite movie. And the way to tell what is your 
favourite movie doesn't have much to do with how well you think the actors 
acted or how good you think the script is, or how well you think the movie 
is directed. It's more basic than that. If it's on television will you stop 
what you're doing and watch it? Will you watch that regardless of whatever 
else may be on? By that standard, Scent of a Woman or Amadeus, or even 
Goodfellas (a movie I would never consciously pick as my favourite!) has to 
be my favourite movie. Do you ever find yourself wishing you knew the 
characters? That's another standard, which is incidentally why American 
Beauty was such a piece of crap. All of the characters in that movie were 
detestable.﻿

comments.author: Milos Doroski

comments.text:
A remarkable movie, an awesome performance from Mr Pacino, who at last won 
his first Oscar after many attempts prior. While filming in the hotel room, 
he tripped over a rug and fell onto a glass topped table damaging an eye 
socket. Filming continued while he recuperated, and his physician remarked 
that he fell just like someone who was (blind) or otherwise partially 
sighted. An indication you'd think of the mans total commitment to the role 
of Lt Col. Frank Slade U.S Army Rtd. Alan Silvestri's score is absolutely 
sublime, utilised beautifully by Dir Martin Brest. James Rebhorn does 
really well as Headmaster Trask, and a special mention for Ferrari dealer 
Freddie, who touches the heart, as his grey ghost speech resonates.﻿

comments.text:
I used to volunteer at a seniors home when I was in high school, and the 
guy I usually spent tiem with was incredibly nearsighted, but not blind. 
One day I took him for a walk in the courtyard, and a girl who also 
volunteered walked by and I started trying to flirt with her. She walked 
away, and he leaned over to me and said "she got a nice ass?" I said yes, 
and he punched my arm and said "then what the hell are you doing with 
me???" I always think of him when I see this movie.
